text: It’s fine, it wasn’t that bad as it hold up, the music was top notch like “The electro suit” was a masterpiece, a death of a major character was so tragic, the villains were ok, the only one that was good was electro, because he had right to be a villain, but overall it’s good.

I probably enjoyed this movie than most people here, but I can still see that the problem with this is that there are too many voices behind the story. The way this story added intricate details to the origin of Spider-Man was consistent with the first part and felt like it cared about being a proper sci-fi. But then the whole character of Electro, which became the weakest part of the movie, is written so lazily in every way that you can clearly see the same person didn't come up with both of them. Despite all the issues this movie had, it also had Andrew and Emma under the direction of 500 Days of Summer, so the romantic portions were great. For most of the movie, it was at its best when it was focused on Peter rather than Spider-Man, and I loved it. As much as a lot of the movie didn't work, there was a lot of stuff that worked really, really well for me. And watching these old Spider-Man movies, all of them always had some scenes that were cool af in a way that the MCU never even tried, and I am glad I got to see it in the theatres. That last slow mo shot of them falling and that web shaping into a hand, how can I not like this!

Marc Webb and Andrew Garfield deserved better, and I am sad this was the end of this iteration. And yeah, Andrew is the best Spidey, no doubt about it.

I love this movie because Andrew Garfield is a great actor, it's totally fit on him. 
The suit in this movie is better than the first movie. the performance or Andrew feels more natural and funnier that used to be.
The villains weren't that great because a felt the need more screen time.

The electro man was pretty interesting at first, but it got kind of weird. This green goblin was not that compelling really. The first half of movie was alright. I would be surprised if they made a 3rd one.
Worst Spider-Man of all time.
might have to rewatch this one

Amo está película, sin embargo está lejos de ser una maravilla. Es más que nada un tráiler de 2 horas que falla en muchas cosas. Pero destaca por sus efectos especiales, el nuevo traje y de nueva cuenta la relación de Peter y Gwen.

Fue repudiada por todos principalmente porque no estaba a la altura de otras grandes películas de super héroes ya existentes que dejaron la vara muy alta. Aún con todo eso es sin duda mil veces mejor que lo que entrega marvel ahora; productos mediocres y carentes de personalidad que los fans hacen pasar como la resurrección del cine de super héroes. Nada ni nadie me hará odiar está película.
Not as bad as people say but not as good as Tasm 1
my favourite movie of all time. FOREVER ANDREW GARFIELD.

This movie is everything but horrible take it from a ginormous spider man fan if I have to admit it is just a little bit rushed with villains and not good character development but besides that it is just AMAZING it really really deserves a 3rd movie.
Amazing adaptation of most characters, yes there may be an abundance of characters but I believe mark webb does a stand out job of fitting them in well
Very underrated Spider-Man movie and I love Andrew Garfield as Spider-Man and I really love how at the he still chose to be Spider-Man after what happened to Gwen

Critics Consensus:
Overlong, overstuffed, and emotionally hollow, The Amazing Spider-Man 2 drowns in its own ambition. What could have been a thrilling continuation of Peter Parker’s story instead collapses under a bloated plot, forced franchise setup, and inconsistent tone.

Andrew Garfield and Emma Stone’s chemistry is the film’s only saving grace, bringing fleeting warmth to an otherwise cold and chaotic movie. Jamie Foxx’s Electro is a visually striking but painfully underwritten villain, while Dane DeHaan’s Green Goblin feels rushed and cartoonish. The film juggles too many subplots—corporate conspiracies, tragic love, villain origins—without giving any of them the time or care they deserve.

Despite flashes of potential and a few impressive action sequences, The Amazing Spider-Man 2 ultimately feels more like a studio checklist than a cohesive story. It’s a disappointing, noisy misfire that smothers its emotional core beneath CGI sparks and tangled storytelling.
Es el mejor Spiderman que haya en el mundo

The amazing Spider-Man 2 at times was the greatest Spider-Man movie ever made who ever made the decision for how green goblin should look should be fired because that was a shitty green goblin the electro fight was awesome the spider man suit was the most realistic suit that spider man has ever had in the movies

I love it so much. Without a doubt, my favorite Spider-Man. The love between Peter and Gwen goes far beyond the movie. And the cinematography is simply incredible. What's not so good is the Green Goblin. Sony once again going too far too fast with the villains.
A lot better than the Tom Holland trilogy, not as good as Tobey’s, although it is better than Spider-Man 3.
This movie takes three days to finish because it’s so bad, watching this movie you will face palm at least 40 times wondering why this movie was approved.

Ahora que la volví a ver... The Amazing Spider-Man 2 es una película muy PERO MUY saturada de subtramas y personajes que hace que la película no profundice del todo bien la trama principal, haciendo que sea una película MUY agridulce. Pero no hay que negar que el traje, el cgi, la química de Peter y Gwen, los balanceos y EL PODEROSO SOUNDTRACK, son MUY BUENOS EN TODO ASPECTO, y eso el lo que está película se salve de que sea una película terrible.
ts is my favorite spider-man movie oat. peak movie,masterpiece,and absolute cinema.
